attributes.action: include Geoff Bailie, Phil Thompson, Stephen Thompson, Andrew Thompson, Michael Scott, Colin McCoy and Chris Hall, a generally well mannered and hilarious bunch of people despite being raised in Northern Ireland at the height of its troubles, in the Queen's Honours List, preferable as Knights of the Realm but one of the "BE"s would be fine
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The above named have all played a significant role in making Northern Ireland a better and safer place to live throughout the duration of their lives. They have contributed to society as Accountants, Ministers of Religion, Pathologists, University lecturers, GPs and Our Price employees. Admittedly one of them now lives in Finland but if Kylie can get a CBE then so can he.

Anyway what harm can it do?  Wouldn't it be better if some ordinary people were made Knights rather than famous people who are probably too busy to do anything?

reasons: Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
